snippet: The fate of the Maoist fighters, who had been living in encampments under guard for the past six years, has been a key sticking point in Nepal’s still incomplete peace process.
abstract: Nepalese government begins releasing more than 7,000 former Maoist fighters from encampments where they have lived under guard since 2006.

byline.contributor: Jim Yardley contributed reporting from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: The fate of the Maoist fighters, who had been living in encampments under guard for the past six years, has been a key sticking point in Nepal’s still incomplete peace process.

headline.seo: Nepal Releases Thousands of Former Maoist Fighters
headline.main: Nepal Releases Thousands of Former Fighters as Part of Peace Deal
